version.name: Barclays Singapore Open
version.description: With a cool $5m prize cash pool up for grabs, top names from the European and Asian golf tours fly in to compete for top honours in Sentosas annual swing-fest.

version.name: PsalmiDeo Chorale Presents Manila, ManiLAH!
version.description: Homesick Pinoys should not miss the all-Filipino, Singapore-based music group PsalmiDeo Chorale at the Singapore Conference Hall. Theyve prepared a moving repertoire of ethnic, traditional, religious and original Filipino music (think Freddie Aguilars 'Anak') as well as unique takes on pop songs and other international hits to perk you up and cheer you on.

version.name: New Balance Real Run Registration
version.description: In this event runners take on three types of terrain consisting of trail, sand and road in various distances for the ultimate running race. Registration closes 15 Sep.

version.name: New Balance Real Run 2010
version.description: Runners take on three types of terrain consisting of trail, sand and road in various distances for the ultimate running race.

version.name: Coney Island Abstract: Continuity/ Discontinuity
version.description: View three of the large-scale canvasses created during a collaborative performance in New York between Singaporean Yeo Shih Yun and American Paul Campbell. The creative process involved public participation, roller blades, remote control cars and balloons.

version.name: North Face 100
version.description: Epic 100km solo race with the winner taking home $5,000 worth of sporting gear and the much-coveted chance to compete in the North Face Finale in Beijing. Registration closes 15 Sep

version.name: The North Face 100
version.description:
Insect repellent, SPF-50 and a large tumbler of water are the must-bring items for anyone heading down to MacRitchie Park on 9 October to soak up the atmosphere of whats been billed as one of the most hotly-contested endurance races ever to be hosted in Singapore.

The epic North Face 100 features two duo events of 50 and 100km each, with mixed-gender teams racing in teams of two, their combined times totalled to give a final race ranking. But the real draw is the marquee event, a by-invitation-only solo 100km race open to just 35 specially selected runners, set to battle it out for $5,000 worth of sponsored love and the probably vastly more coveted chance to compete in the grand finale in Beijing on 11 May next year.

The route is still something of a mystery but is thought to course around Singapores Central Catchment area, beginning and ending at MacRitchie Park. So as to prevent any advance planning by the runners, the organisers will be keeping the exact route under wraps until a week before the event. It is, after all, a trail race, so runners are supposed to be all primed up for the unexpected natural conditions.

True to the core of The North Face Pledge, the organisers themselves have played an active role in ensuring the sustainability and conservation of the nature reserves with their Trail Maintenance project. Starting in August, the initative invited participants and volunteers to come out and get their hands dirty, laying logs and cookies to prevent soil erosion. So do keep an eye out for the results of the conservation project, and cheer on the runners but remember, no feeding the monkeys. Jonathan Tan

To find out how to compete in next years race see www.thenorthface100.com.sg.

event.name: Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon 2010 Running Clinics

version.name: Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon 2010 Running Clinics
version.description: Find out how best to prepare for a gruelling 42km full marathon in this workshop hosted by a number of athletics professionals.

version.name: Sun Yoga Conference
version.description:
Align your chakras and indulge in the art of asanas in this specially programmed workshop that spans anatomy and philosophy to yoga's invigorating forms.

Various Timings

version.name: Nature Keeper Programme: Monkey & You
version.description:
Learn how to interpret the facial expressions and behaviours of long-tailed macaques.

Call 6554 5123).

event.name: Nature Appreciated Guided Walk - A Walk in an Ancient Forest

version.name: Nature Appreciated Guided Walk - A Walk in an Ancient Forest
version.description:
Walk in awe amid the largest surviving primary forest in Singapore.

Call 6554 5127.

version.name: The Halong Bay Series
version.description: Evocative renderings of Halong Bay in Vietnam through broad gestural strokes by Malaysian artist Soon Lai Wai.
version.property:
Mon-Fri 11.30am-7pm,
Sat noon-6pm,
Sun and public holidays by appointment only.

event.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Getting to Know Gesneriads

version.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Getting to Know Gesneriads
version.description: Find out how these compact flowering plants thrive in Singapores humid climate and why theyre best suited for small spaces.

version.name: HortPark Butterfly Garden Tour
version.description: Get up close to observe nearly 20 species of pupae transform into adult butterflies before taking their maiden flight.

version.name: A Crafty Conference (INDEFINITELY POSTPONED)
version.description:
Above: OMFG Co, one of the speakers at the conference. Ed's note: This event has been indefinitely postponed. According to the organisers, while the conference received feedback outside of Singapore, it has not reached its local target. Digital technology has been saving time in the workplace for decades. Revenue streams continue to flood the pockets of both the technological and corporate worlds, and there are no signs of this ever slowing down. So what is being lost in this mad rush to get projects completed? Members of the arts community, and their works, can be seen as getting royally screwed in this mad rush to get their creations often demeaningly referred to merely as content into the public domain. A Crafty Conference, taking place this month, is a reaction to this overuse of technology in the design industry.

The conference curator is art director Felix Ng, founder of local design think tank Anonymous. He attributes some of the inspiration that went into Crafty to Richard Sennetts book The Craftsman. The book conveys what Ng believes is the ideal process in designing: Sennett discusses making things using your hands, and the idea that creating something with your hands encourages you to think conceptually.

Ng says that as a designer, he feels the industry is in danger. I feel like the value of design and designers are in decline. This is because we are increasingly seen as plastic surgeons, dealing in aesthetics only to package products, whether they are good or bad. Observations made during his six years of experience as a designer, and the frustration he accumulated, triggered his need to take action. Designers are not thinking, sketching, or prototyping. This is because most of us are working a lot for very little money. There is not enough consideration for the industry, and design is suffering as a result. People are just trying to churn out quantity while quality fades to the background.

Ngs idea for the conference sprang from a conversation with friend and designer Larry Peh, who will also be speaking at the conference about his own studio processes and methods. Peh complains to Ng about a lazy approach used by other designers he works with: when designers first receive a brief, their initial reaction is to go online and look for aesthetic references on websites like www.notcot.com, which serve as online bulletin boards of inspiration, updated daily with samples of design from around the world. The designers then use these images to create a mood board as reference, supposedly kicking off the creative process. But somewhere along the way, the art element is being lost.

The conference will showcase the works of 14 designers or design studios that have continued to incorporate craftsmanship into their work. Those on display hail from various fields of design, such as graphics, fashion, film and advertising. True to the creative spirit of the event, Ng is adamant that A Crafty Conference should not have sponsors. This is so we dont spend our time chasing people to give us money, but rather investing time into the conference to make sure it is of quality. We have created partnerships with LaSalle-College of the Arts and with Old School, both places that have been very generous by giving us space to use as conference venues.

Though conference tickets carry a hefty price tag ($250), the purchase gives you entrance to the conference and the after-party (featuring three Singaporean sound systems), an extension of the conference. Instead of just a drink-and-mingle session in a bar, the party will feature live performances and installations by musicians, designers and painters, Ng says.

Tickets also entitle you to a copy of A Crafty Paper, a 40-page A2 publication in newsprint. It includes 15 interviews with luminaries from various creative fields, such as Aaron Rose, the founder of Alleged Gallery in New York, and Stanley Donwood, the designer behind Radioheads iconic album covers. This year, Crafty will focus on the conferences speakers and Q&A sessions, but Ng hopes Crafty will see a round two in the future in which workshop sessions will be integrated, with speakers leading delegates through hands-on practical experience.

Ng hopes that the conference can increase awareness about the importance of quality and craftsmanship, so that designers stop making more, and focus on making better and higher quality things. His objective for Crafty is to encourage designers to discover working in a new old way that has been forgotten in favour of convenience, so that in future the old adage, They just dont make things like that anymore, will be consigned firmly to the past.

This story first appeared as Crafty young devils (TOS Oct 2010).

version.name: Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon
version.description: Theres a whole range of race categories for both children and adults included within the main event, the prized full marathon. Race registration closes on 30 Sep.

version.name: Great Eastern Women 10K
version.description: Watch thousands of women take on Asias biggest female-only semi-competitive run in either the 6km or 10km distances.

version.name: 63rd International Rugby 7s
version.description:
Singapore Cricket Clubs hotly contested annual three-day rugby fest returns to The Padang with the near-unstoppable South African Vipers looking to defend their 2009 title against a broad range of international teams including Hong Kong, the UK, Australia, New Zealand, the US, Fiji and Japan. As always, action at the bar is taken as seriously as the sport, and there are plenty of sideline activities for spectators.

$50 adults, $25 children

version.name: Confusions
version.description: The Stage Club presents this Alan Ayckbourn comedy set in 1970s England, in which relationships get more complicated over four acts, and are resolved through memorable scenes on park benches.

version.name: Iron Man CollARTible Exhibition
version.description: Check out the life-sized figure of Iron Mans trusty sidekick War Machine, among other collectables like limited-edition and rare vintage Iron Man comics.

event.name: LaSalle-College of the Arts and Asian Civilisations Museum

version.name: LaSalle-College of the Arts and Asian Civilisations Museum
version.description: Inspired by the 'Sumatra: Isle of Gold' showcase, LaSalle Art students put together an exhibition of their creations that explore the diversity of three dimensional forms.

version.name: Fright Night!
version.description: Swathe yourself in spooky robes and haunt the museum galleries with the Singapore Paranormal Investigators as your ghoulish guides in tow.

event.name: A Musical Banquet (The Conservatory Chamber Singers)

version.name: A Musical Banquet (The Conservatory Chamber Singers)
version.description: The CCS perform the Latin spice of Anders Edenroths Chili Con Carne, David Dickaus lush, romantic If Music Be the Food of Love, John Rutters Banquet Fugue and Messiaens O Sacrum Convivium.

version.name: Austrian Wine Festival 2010
version.description: Set your tastebuds free in this month-long festival that celebrates wine from Austria, with over 60 wines and 23 premium wineries. Expect activities such as food pairing and informal talks on wine. Singapore-based Austrian chefs will whip up a spread for the opening night at Brasserie Wolf. Other participating restaurants include Les Amis, Brasserie Wolf, Esmirada, Bistro Soori, Fifty Three, Song of India, Bodega Y Tapas, Angelos, The Steakhouse and Warehouse Bistro.

event.name: Guided Walk at Sensory Trail - Pulau Ubin

version.name: Guided Walk at Sensory Trail - Pulau Ubin
version.description:
See, touch, taste and smell the different plants of this last rural offshoot of Singapore.

Call 6524 4108.

version.name: Soliloquy
version.description: A contemplative exhibition of nature by documentary photographer Terence Teo, taken on his trip to Japan in 2010. This veers away from his usual natural-disaster-documenting works.

version.name: Simple Secrets of Composition
version.description: Hosts of Channel News Asia's documentary strand Scene: Singapore, Tom Ang, teaches intermediate-level photographers simple techniques on improving composition and integrating them with personal compsition styles. Beginners welcome.

version.name: Pink Beats
version.description: A vocal journey about women, by women, performed by a cast of 13 musicians performing everything from classical opera to rhythm and blues. Proceeds go to the Singapore Breast Cancer Foundation.

version.name: Korean Eye: Fantastic Ordinary
version.description:
Above: Existing in Costume Beauty and the Beast by Bae Chan Hyo
A follow-up to last years Korean Eye: Moon Generation, this Standard Chartered-sponsored touring exhibition received an overwhelming response at Londons Saatchi Gallery. This year sees 30 works by emerging and established Korean contemporary artists like Jeon Chae-gang and Lee Rim.

version.name: Jimmy Ong
version.description: In this self-titled exhibition, one of Singapores most renowned contemporary artists explores the human condition and relationships with a new series of unconventional and provocative calligraphic works on paper.

version.name: Tabitha Christmas Silk Fair
version.description: A pre-Christmas sale for the benefit of Tabitha Foundation Singapore's community programmes in Cambodia. On sale are high quality silk bedding, home decor, Christmas decorations, gifts, toys and accessories, all handmade by the Cottage Industry in Cambodia.

version.name: Brahmsâ Third (NAFA Orchestra)
version.description: Wagners Meistersinger Overture, Schumanns masterly piano concerto and Brahms third symphony, conducted by Volker Hartung. Pianist to be announced.

version.name: Beatrice Berthold Piano Recital
version.description: The German pianist plays noted works by Granados, Ravel, Chopin and Villa-Lobos.

event.name: Pompeii: Life in a Roman Town 79CE

version.name: Pompeii: Life in a Roman Town 79CE
version.description: Organised by Melbourne Museum and Soprintendenza Speciale per i beni Archeologici di Napoli e Pompei, this exhibition reconstructs this cosmopolitan town pre-destruction. Various artifacts indicative of its prosperity will be on display ranging from jewellery, frescoes, sculptures to household items. Even body casts of eight victims who were immortalised during their final moments when Mount Vesuvius erupted will be showcased. Photo: Cast of a guard dog; House of Orpheus, Pompeii ©Soprintendenza Speciale per I beni Archeologici di Napoli e Pompei

event.name: Pompeii: Life in a Roman Town 79CE: A parent-and-child-mosaic-art-workshop

version.name: Pompeii: Life in a Roman Town 79CE: A parent-and-child-mosaic-art-workshop
version.description: Create an elaborate animal-mosaic art piece using small pieces of stone, glass, beads, marble, shell and tiles in an abstract or pictorial form, mimicking the decor of the wealthy early Greeks, Romans and Pompeiians. For ages 6-8.

version.name: Discovering Pompeii
version.description:
Embark on an interactive tour of Pompeii and experience daily life in this Roman town during 79CE before the disaster.

For ages 9-12.

version.name: Dave Wang
version.description: Mando- and Canto-pop chart topper Wang is best known for evergreen hits like A Game, A Dream and You Are the Ache in My Heart. This performance is a real heartstring tugger for the patient fans whove waited 21 years for his return to the island.

version.name: Korean Pop Night Concert
version.description: A K-Pop extravaganza, tailor-made for excitable teens, with a monster line-up topped by one of the countrys biggest acts, the fresh-faced reality-show quintet Big Bang. Plus a plethora of support acts including FT Island, SNSD, Infinite, SHINee and The Boss (D-NA).

version.name: Metamorphoses
version.description:
Ovids dark myths about the intertwining of gods and man get a fresh reinterpretation from Collab Theatre Ensemble with a pool onstage. Christina Sergeant directs.

Read our story on Collab Theatre Ensemble.

version.name: Manit Sriwanichpoom: Phenomena & Prophecies
version.description:
Known for his iconic neon-pink-clad man, Manit Sriwanichpooms photographs deal with themes of consumption and other social and political issues central to Thailand. This exhibition will be over 100 photographs from his oeuvre.

Read our interview with Manit Sriwanichpoom here.

version.name: Ma Goes Home
version.description: Edgar Liaos award-winning supernatural comedy-musical tells a tale of a Singaporean woman who, in her afterlife, is unable to get to home soil because she died in her nursing home in Johor Bahru.

version.name: Open Doors Weekend Market
version.description:
Handmade jewellery, vintage and second-hand fashion and nail polish are just a few of the goods on offer. There's also popcorn, candyfloss machines and musical entertainment.

Saturdays & Sundays

version.name: FINA/Arena Swimming World Cup 2010
version.description:
The second of a seven-leg global competition, where events in freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke and butterfly all take place in a 25m pool as opposed to the usual 50m pools used for the Olympics and World Championships. Here's your chance to see newly married Olympic Gold-winning backstroke queen Natalie Coughlin of the USA, the first athelete in modern Olympic history to win six meals in an Olympic event.

$20 (one day); $30 (two days) Tel: 6258 1011

version.name: Kings & Queen of Comedy Asia
version.description: With drag queen Kumar as compere, get ready to laugh at the jokes of five of Asia's funniest standup comics: Harith Iskander (Malaysia), Var Das (India), Hung Le (Vietnam) and Douglas Lim (Singapore).

version.name: Roktober
version.description: The car park in front of The Substation will be converted into an alfresco area for bands, boozing, bratwurst-munching and Singapore's first beer pong championship.

version.name: Roktober!
version.description:
Oktoberfest gets the full rock n roll treatment this month care of the good folks at Timbre, whove done the decent thing and converted their car park into a giant, three-day open-air drinking party. Beer and rock have long been the central pillars of any p**s-up worth talking about, and this non-ticketed freebie is no different, as Roktober! tucks gallons of Erdinger and a swashbuckling medley of local pop-rawk bands into bed for one heady coitus of beer-chugging stammtisch.

Onstage girl-boy hip-hop sextet Sixx bring their soul-tinged instrumentalism to the fold with indie psych-funksters The Pinholes and harder-edged rockers Ministry of Rock rolling out the tuneage alongside the likes of the much-loved Blues Jam outfi t, while cheerful young guitar slingers Imprompt-3 lay down their sleepy brand of chilled-out acoustica. Bratwursts provided; buxom FrauÌleins and Lederhosen-clad Herren may not be. Alexander Barlow

version.name: Valentino, Retrospective: Past/Present/Future
version.description: If you didn't make it to the retired Italian couturier's farewell extravaganza in 2008, here's your chance to see what you missed. It's not the complete collection exhibited in 'Valentino a Roma: 45 Years of Style' at the Richard Meier-designed Ara Pacis museum (featured in Matt Tyranauer's Valentino: The Last Emperor) but there wlll be 100 dresses, some of them once worn by the world's most glamorous women such as Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, Julia Roberts and Nicole Kidman. The retrospective will also include works by Maria Grazia Chiuri and Pier Paolo Piccioli, current creative directors of the House of Valentino. Ticket prices will be announced in October.

event.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Native Plants

version.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Native Plants
version.description: Learn about the significance and unique traits of the 2,200-plus native plant species Sir Stamford Raffles helped start records of, including tips on their cultivation and use.

version.name: Fun with Brownies!
version.description:
Reach some crazy sugar highs as you bake the scariest, most demonic-looking brownie this Halloween, long before the trick-or-treating even begins. This hands-on workshop includes preparing, baking and, of course the best part, decorating. Sprinkles, icings, stencils and colourful decorating gels are all included, so go wild.

For ages 7 & above.

event.name: New Zealand Wine Twilight Taste Tour and Masterclass

version.name: New Zealand Wine Twilight Taste Tour and Masterclass
version.description: Study hard, party hard. Spend an afternoon learning about 'Sauvignon Blanc & Beyond' and then move to The Club hotel's rooftop bar for a Twilight Taste Tour of over 40 delicious New Zealand wines, served with food matches, from six to nine in the evening. You can either attend the Masterclass ($38) or Twilight Taste Tour ($68) as separate events or go to both events for a combined ticket price ($78).

version.name: 53A @ TAB
version.description: The rock quartet unveils its debut album Settle the Kettle. Tonight they play alongside resident artist, Jason Mraz-esque Californian jazz acoustic-RnB crooner Justin Young.

version.name: Sixx
version.description: Local six-piece hip-hop crew fuses rock, rap and soul with originals played on live instruments. Tonight they play alongside this weeks resident artists, Oak and Gorski.

version.name: Inch Chua
version.description: Pop starlet performs summery tunes alongside resident US artist Trey Lockerbie, whose tastefully orchestrated, introspective-yet-accessible tunes recall artists like Greg Laswell and Snow Patrol.

version.name: Wallace Education Centre Gallery Walk
version.description: Natural history aside, this walk teaches the importance of being proactive when it comes to biodiversity conservation.

event.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Hoppety Hop

version.name: Community in Bloom Library Talk: Hoppety Hop
version.description: Learn about the wonderful world of Singapore's frogs and toads, and how climate change could affect their survival.
